# Other things to include in the output

- think that the developer is a student or a junior developer so explain why things are done a certain way.
- explain what went wrong.
- provide code examples where applicable.
- suggest best practices and improvements.
- be concise and clear in your explanations.
- teach the developer about the concepts involved.
- teach the developer the design or the library or framework being used or the architecture pattern, everything that is relevant to the code being reviewed.
- help the developer improve their skills and knowledge.
- help the developer write better, cleaner, and more efficient code.
- help the developer to learn things they might not be aware of.
- When suggesting changes, provide specific code examples showing before/after.
